laboratory_examinations.findings: Markedly hypercellular marrow (85%), diffusely involved by small lymphocytic infiltration (80%), tumor cells positive for CD20, CD5, and CD23, negative for CD3, CD10, TdT, and cyclin D1.
Lymphadenopathy in mediastinum, bilateral neck, axillary area, enterocoelia, retroperitoneal and pelvic cavity, splenomegaly, and partial thickening in the small intestine.
Three polyps with sizes of 0.8 cm, 0.7 cm, and 0.4 cm, pathological analysis indicated tubular adenoma with low-grade dysplasia.

Detected pathogenic hotspot mutations of STAT5B (c.1924A>C, p.N642H) and DNMT3A (c.2678G>A, p.W893*), along with likely pathogenic mutations and variants of uncertain clinical significance in various genes.
